question: In the titration of potassium permanganate (<katex>$\text{KMnO}_4$</katex>) against Ferrous ammonium sulphate (FAS) solution, dilute sulphuric acid but not nitric acid is used to maintain acidic medium, because
choices: It is difficult to identify the end point
Nitric acid doesn't act as an indicator
Nitric acid itself is an oxidizing agent
Nitric acid is a weaker acid than sulphuric acid
explanation: Nitric acid (<katex>$\text{HNO}_3$</katex>) is a strong oxidizing agent itself and would interfere with the redox titration by oxidizing the ferrous ions.
